summary: Brief introductions and role confirmations; no decisions were made. Actions include PM to assign priorities, Architect and Developer to handle architecture/implementation tasks, and QA to run tests when changes are posted with expected outputs.

actions.task: Clarify priorities and assign implementation tasks to the developer (Alex).
Be available to address architecture questions, design decisions, and unblock technical issues.
Pick up the highest-priority implementation task once assigned by the PM.
Run tests when changes are posted with "Ready for testing!" and the expected output; report results.

risks.risk: Developer may be idle or blocked if priorities/tasks are not assigned.
risks.mitigation: PM to assign tasks and clarify priorities promptly; schedule backlog grooming if needed.

risks.risk: Insufficient acceptance criteria or expected outputs may cause testing delays and rework.
risks.mitigation: Require changes to be posted with clear expected output and acceptance criteria (QA to enforce "Ready for testing!" convention).

risks.risk: Architectural blockers could delay implementation if not surfaced early.
risks.mitigation: Loop the architect in early for design reviews and set up quick syncs to resolve blockers.
